column5: Oct 29 Contract drugmaker Patheon Inc  will buy Banner Pharmacaps  which focuses on gelatin-based oral drug delivery technology  for $255 million  to expand its presence in the over-the-counter market and gain a foothold in Mexico.

column4: CME's Duffy: Longer grain-trading to stay
column5: CHICAGO CME Group Inc  will maintain the nearly round-the-clock electronic grain-trading that it implemented in May despite criticism by some traders that the new format is hurting market liquidity  a top executive told Reuters on Monday.

column4: CME's Duffy: longer grain-trading hours are here to stay
column5: CHICAGO  Oct 29 CME Group Inc will not trim electronic grain-trading hours  which it expanded in May to fend off a challenge from rival IntercontinentalExchange  a top executive told Reuters.

column4: CME Group to reopen stock-index  rate trading Monday evening
column5: CHICAGO  Oct 29 CME Group Inc will reopen trading in stock-index and interest-rate futures and options Monday evening  the exchange operator said in a statement.

column4: CME Group's rate contracts trading to close early
column5: CHICAGO  Oct 29 CME Group Inc will shut down trading in interest-rate futures and options at 12 noon ET (1600 GMT) on Monday  a spokeswoman said  in line with the closing time of the underlying cash markets.

column5: NEW YORK Drugmaker Pfizer Inc  and power companies Entergy Corp  and NRG Energy Inc  said they would postpone releasing quarterly earnings results because of the hurricane approaching the U.S. Northeast.

column4: Shionogi to take 10 pct stake in GSK  Pfizer HIV drug venture
column5: TOKYO  Oct 29 Japan's Shionogi & Co  said on Monday that it will take a 10 percent stake in Viiv Healthcare  a AIDS drug joint venture between GlaxoSmithKline  and Pfizer  in exchange for its rights to the drug Dolutegravir.

column4: Supreme Court takes PPL appeal in tax credit case
column5: WASHINGTON The Supreme Court said on Monday it will take the rare step of considering a tax case  one with hundreds of millions of dollars at stake and broad implications for companies with businesses abroad and for the Internal Revenue Service.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. Supreme Court takes PPL appeal in tax credit case
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 29 The U.S. Supreme Court said on Monday it will take the rare step of considering a tax case  one with hundreds of millions of dollars at stake and broad implications for companies with businesses abroad an d for the Internal Revenue Service.

column4: US Supreme Court accepts PPL appeal in British tax case
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 29 The Supreme Court agreed on Monday to consider whether a U.S. company is entitled to a tax credit when it pays a so-called "windfall tax" imposed by the United Kingdom.

column4: Serbian state bank absorbs assets  clients of Nova Agrobanka
column5: BELGRADE  Oct 29 Serbia's state-run Postanska Stedionica (PS) bank took over the assets and 260 000 clients of troubled Nova Agrobanka on Monday  seeking to end a scandal that has rocked the country's financial system.

column4: Insurer Direct Line to cut 70 management jobs
column5: LONDON  Oct 29 Direct Line Group  the British motor and home insurer spun out of Royal Bank of Scotland  is to shed 70 senior roles under a previously-announced plan to take out 100 million pounds ($160.98 million) in costs  it said on Monday.

column4: Garcia ready for end of season run after eye surgery
column5: Former world number two Sergio Garcia will make his comeback after eye surgery in the European Tour's season-ending Dubai World Championship next month.

column4: Sky's the limit for Colsaerts after Ryder Cup exploits
column5: Nicolas Colsaerts  dubbed 'The Dude' by his team mates after making a stylish Ryder Cup debut last month  is still floating on a cloud four weeks after Europe's stunning victory in Chicago.

column4: STOCKS NEWS SINGAPORE-Mermaid up on Seadrill deal  contract win
column5: Shares of Mermaid Maritime Pcl rose as much as 12 percent after the offshore services provider said Seadrill Ltd  plans to acquire its associate and its joint venture won a $530 million five-year contract.

column4: Southern  KBR form alliance to advance coal-plant technology
column5: HOUSTON A partnership between a subsidiary of Southern Co  and KBR Inc  will market a coal-gasification technology to power companies worldwide  the companies said in a release on Monday.

column4: Telefonica prices German sale in lower half of range
column5: FRANKFURT/LONDON Spain's Telefonica  priced the sale of shares in its German O2-branded unit in the bottom half of its indicative range  raising as much as 1.45 billion euros ($1.9 billion) in Europe's largest new listing in more than a year.

column4: UPDATE 3-Telefonica prices German sale in lower half of range
column5: * Telefonica to raise as much as 1.45 bln euros   (Updates after final pricing)

column4: Telefonica to sell shares at 5.60 eur in German IPO-source
column5: FRANKFURT  Oct 29 Telefonica SA is set sell shares in its German subsidiary at 5.60 euros apiece  a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Monday.

column4: Telefonica to price German IPO at lower end of range: sources
column5: FRANKFURT Telefonica SA  is expected to sell shares in its German O2-branded subsidiary at the lower end of its indicative price range  four people involved with the initial public offering (IPO) told Reuters.

column4: Telefonica narrows price range for German IPO-sources
column5: FRANKFURT  Oct 29 Telefonica SA has narrowed the indicative price range for the listing of its German O2-branded subsidiary  three people close to the process told Reuters.

column4: CME's Duffy: longer grain-trading hours are here to stay
column5: CHICAGO  Oct 29 CME Group Inc will not trim electronic grain-trading hours  which it expanded in May to fend off a challenge from rival IntercontinentalExchange  a top executive told Reuters.

column4: Dymon launches private equity fund with Temasek unit's backing
column5: HONG KONG Dymon Asia Capital is branching out to the private equity world  launching a fund with backing from a unit of Singapore state investor Temasek Holdings  a company email obtained by Reuters shows  indicating an uncommon move by a hedge fund.

column4: UPDATE 2-Ford tumbles again in reliability survey; Toyota gains
column5: * Ford  Chrysler sink in Consumer Reports reliability survey

column4: Ford falls further in reliability survey; Toyota gains
column5: DETROIT Ford Motor Co tumbled to nearly the bottom of an annual survey of vehicle reliability due to flaws in its touch-screen navigation and entertainment system  while Japanese rival Toyota Motor Corp swept the top three spots.

column4: Ford falls further in reliability survey; Toyota gains
column5: DETROIT  Oct 29 Ford Motor Co dropped another seven spots to next to last place in an important annual survey of vehicle reliability due to flaws in its touch-screen navigation system and other issues with its new or redesigned models.

column4: Small should have been beautiful; how Toyota misread China market
column5: BEIJING Toyota Motor Corp  blames its China underperformance on the widespread anti-Japan protests triggered by a territorial row. Some company insiders and dealers  though  say the world's biggest car maker misread the world's largest market.

column4: UPDATE 1-Small should have been beautiful; how Toyota misread China market

column4: UPDATE 1-TransCanada  Phoenix Energy to build C$3 bln Alberta pipeline
column5: Oct 29 TransCanada Corp  Canada's largest pipeline company  will build a C$3 billion ($3.01 billion) pipeline in northern Alberta with privately held Phoenix Energy Holdings Ltd to transport crude from the Athabasca oilsands.

column4: TransCanada signs JV for C$3 bln pipeline project in N Alberta
column5: Oct 29 TransCanada Corp has formed a joint venture with Phoenix Energy Holdings Ltd to develop a C$3 billion pipeline project in Northern Alberta.

column4: UPS sees 10 percent rise in holiday shipping  to hire 55 000 workers
column5: United Parcel Service Inc  expects shipments during the upcoming holiday season to hit record levels this year  up 10 percent from last year  and plans to hire 55 000 seasonal workers to handle the added volume.

column4: TNT Express quarterly profit down 12 percent
column5: AMSTERDAM TNT Express   the Dutch mail delivery group being bought by UPS  said third-quarter profit fell 12 percent.

column4: Lessons from Irene help retailers cope with Sandy
column5: NEW YORK Retailers preparing for the worst of Hurricane Sandy as it hit the East Coast on Monday looked back to only a year ago to Hurricane Irene for a blueprint.

column4: UPDATE 2-Yamana Gold profit falls on metal prices
column5: TORONTO  Oct 29 Canadian miner Yamana Gold Inc  reported a 6 percent fall in third-quarter adjusted profit on Monday as lower metal prices and higher production costs outweighed strong gold sales volumes.

column4: Yamana Gold profit falls on metal prices
column5: Oct 29 Canadian miner Yamana Gold Inc  reported a 6 percent fall in third-quarter adjusted profit on Monday as lower metal prices and higher costs outweighed higher gold sales volumes.

column4: NZ's Morrison joins bids for Stansted airport-sources
column5: LONDON New Zealand investment manager Morrison & Co has entered the race for Britain's Stansted airport  people familiar with the situation said  which has been put on the block by Ferrovial  the operator of Europe's biggest airport Heathrow.
